ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: My drawing skills improved, and I learned how to view the world more critically when drawing from observation.
Incredible course that introduces the fundamentals of drawing and teaches students how to capture tones, shapes/compositions, and more complex subjects of our choosing.
An appreciation for the process of creating art, the magic of unfiltered observation, an emotional connection to engaging with art.

Not only have I developed a vocabulary and the ability to analyze art through a sophisticated lens, but this course has also given me a new perspective and way to see the world around me every day. I have also gained more confidence in my art and how to present myself as well.
basic drawing skills
Drawing with various mediums

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Even though this course was three hours long on Tuesday nights, it was a very manageable workload. It was always a relaxing and enjoyable class to attend which made the time go by quickly.
No weaknesses.
Strengths: fantastic environment for exploring your artistic interests, perspectives, and creativity in a relaxed and supportive setting

I think that this class is generally well structured. Homework assignments take many hours, but that is the name of the game. Also, the readings for this class gave me goosebumps. They are the most engaging I have had in four years of college.
All strengths. Justin is superb.
very engaging, individualized support, justin is an amazing instructor in all possible ways
Very unique class with a lot of creative aspects. There was a bit too much focus on charcoal.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course as it was a nice contrast to my other classes this semester. It was very enjoyable and challenged different parts of my brain.
Absolutely.
Absolutely! Professor Kim is a wonderful instructor who leads intriguing discussions that challenge your approach and mentality to art.
I would recommend this course to ANYONE! It is a humbling, but eye-opening journey. It leaves you being able to benefit from a richer experience of life.

Yes, most definitely. Regardless of previous art experience I think it is a great insight into art, the world, the people around you as well as yourself. You'd be amazed the progress you make from week to week let alone throughout the entirety of the semester and it's a good exercise in fully committing to doing something outside of your comfort zone.

Yes 100%! Justin is amazing. He has gotten every aspect of this course down to a science. The assignments (both group and individualized) were carefully crafted to develop a particular skill. We met weekly for individual feedback, which is soooo much better than most of my crappy STEM courses. Our in-class work and critiques were a lovely way to spend my Tuesday nights, and the other students helped to make it a warm, relaxing environment, even though we were all laser-focused and striving to improve. Justin's emphasis on observation and process, rather than particular techniques, could be frustrating if you are an experienced artist. (But if that's you -- you probably shouldn't be looking at this anyway!) I felt that Justin made such a strong effort to understand each of us as a person, and pushed us to engage with ourselves and the things we drew in a way that I want to take into the other aspects of my life. Take this course if you can!!

Definitely! This course will meet you where you are at as an artist, and help me improve greatly, particularly in my way of thinking and approach. The main medium we used was charcoal, which I hadn't had much experience with partly because it seemed daunting, but I can now say that I feel confident in my approach and abilities when given charcoal, a blank paper, and a drawing prompt.
yes! one of my favorite classes at yale and encouraged me to take more art classes
Yes, you learn a lot about how to draw and how to interpret drawings
